meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of Tonga.
meanings.sent1: In Tonga, you can buy many things with just one seniti.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for seniti at the bank.
meanings.sent3: Why did the seniti go to school? To learn how to multiply!
meanings.sent4: The seniti danced in the sunlight, shimmering like gold.
meanings.sent5: The seniti jingled in his pocket, a sound of wealth.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Tonga.
meanings.sent1: She saved up every seniti to buy a new dress.
meanings.sent2: The price of the fruit was just a few seniti.
meanings.sent3: The seniti rolled off the table and onto the floor, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: His words were like seniti, valuable and carefully chosen.
meanings.sent5: The beggar's eyes lit up when a kind stranger dropped a seniti into his cup.

meanings.sent1: I counted the seniti in my wallet and realized I had enough for the bus fare.
meanings.sent2: The market vendor priced the fruits in seniti.
meanings.sent3: The seniti gathered in a circle, discussing their worth.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a handful of seniti, infectious and joyful.
meanings.sent5: The seniti sparkled in the moonlight, a constellation of wealth.
